pr_title: ServiceBus Track 2 Peek operation on Management channel  ( Include $cbs channel for auth)

timeline.message: peek and management channel with $cbs channel

timeline.bodyText: This already exists in RequestResponseChannel.java. Is there a reason it is here?
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: Access modifier and using final instead. Consider setting Collections.emptyList instead.

timeline.bodyText: Why does a connection know about these modes? I'd expect them to be parameters when creating a receiver or sender or when creating the management node itself.

timeline.bodyText: Can this live as a private static method in RequestResponseChannel.
timeline.author: conniey

replies.bodyText: Since this is related to reading the status code from AmqpMessages, a better place would be to put it in MessageUtils. There should be a class already
replies.author: conniey

replies.bodyText: RequestResponseUtils.getResponseStatusCode( is used by )  RequestResponseChannel  and also by  ServiceBusMessageSerializer and shared. Thuis I put it in amqp-core and  there is no MessageUtils in amqp-core  .
replies.author: hemanttanwar

timeline.bodyText: nit:  empty line
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: nit: new line
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: Why do we pass in the TokenManager here. iirc, before we create the ManagementChannel, we already create a token manager that authorizes with it. We shouldn't need to manually authorize ourselves.
timeline.author: conniey

replies.bodyText: The TokenManager instance is created before ManagementChannel is created but does not call TokenManager.authorize(). So we pass this instance in ManagementChannel  because  it knows when user makes first call to peek. First call to authorize() should happen when user does peek operation, So  we call it once only just before peek is called.
replies.author: hemanttanwar

timeline.bodyText: This doesn't need to be public
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: Every time a peek operation is called, it'll create another management channel node.  This is a bit wasteful if we keep getting the management node and have to recreate it.
timeline.author: conniey
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -101,10 +117,14 @@ public ServiceBusReactorAmqpConnection(String connectionId, ConnectionOptions co
                     logger.info("Creating management node. entityPath: [{}]. address: [{}]. linkName: [{}]",
                         entityPath, address, linkName);
 
+                    TokenManager cbsBasedTokenManager =  new AzureTokenManagerProvider(

replies.bodyText:
I have tested with 4 peek() calls from one client , since we are storing ServiceBusManagementNode in ConcurrentHashMap  and return cached managementNode after once created using managementNodes.computeIfAbsent . So it creates ServiceBusManagementNode only once.
https://github.com/Azure/azure-sdk-for-java/pull/8983/files#diff-6460b86560d643d02d2e58af8b6213cfL96
replies.author: hemanttanwar

timeline.bodyText: Move these to tests and use stepverifier.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: sender.send(message).then(receiver.peek()) is probably what you want. thenMany suggests it returns a flux.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: When you return inline mocks like this, you need to add the Mockito.clearInlinMocks() or else it won't be garbage collected.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: casing should be Amqp rather than AMQP
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: This is a hack to maintain state.
timeline.author: conniey

replies.bodyText: We can look into it in more detail and make it better.
replies.author: hemanttanwar

timeline.bodyText: These don't need to be public because the class is not public.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: Why does this need to be public?
timeline.author: conniey

replies.bodyText: It doesn't need to be a variable because enums are basically static. You can pass the values in as-is in the constructor.
replies.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: AppProperties as a parameter isn't necessary, you always pass the same parameter.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: You should dispose of the existing one (created in BeforeEach) if you are going to recreate it. It'll still consume resources.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: Should put this in AfterEach, if the test fails at line 163, it'll never be run.
timeline.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: Do you have a test that peeks the next sequence number?
timeline.author: conniey
